issues.description: The prose in the problem statement (Part 2, task 'Implement Add Guest Students') says to implement addGuestStudents(String), while the UML diagram and the intended solution use addGuestStudents(int). This is a parameter type mismatch in the specification: students reading the textual description could implement a method that accepts a String and later find that the UML, tests, or reference solution expect an int parameter, causing confusion and possible compile/test failures.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the problem statement consistent: change the textual description that currently says addGuestStudents(String) to addGuestStudents(int) to match the UML and the solution. Alternatively, if the intention was to accept a String, update the UML, template, and solution to use a String parameter and adjust tests accordingly. The former (changing the prose to int) is the least disruptive and aligns with the rest of the materials.
